taxon_name.authority: de Candolle in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle
A. Gray in A. Gray et al.

taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family asteraceae;tribe cichorieae;genus malacothrix;species foliosa;subspecies polycephala

bio:treatment.description: Stems usually 1, erect, branched distally. Distal cauline leaves narrowly triangular, usually pinnately lobed (near bases, lobes 1–2 pairs, narrow). Calyculi of 8–12+, oblong to linear bractlets. Involucres 5–7 × 2–4.5 mm. Phyllaries 12–16+ in 2–3 series. Corollas medium yellow, 5–9 mm; outer ligules exserted 1.5–3.5 mm. Cypselae ± cylindro-fusiform, 0.9–1.5 mm, ribs ± equal. 2n = 14.

verbatim.text: Flowering Mar–Jul. Open sandy areas, dunes, between shrubs in chaparral; 0–100 m; Calif.

parsed.habitat: Open sandy areas, dunes, between shrubs in chaparral;

bio:treatment.discussion: Subspecies polycephala is known only from San Nicolas Island.
